IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: PUBLIC HEALTH STATEMENT Behavioral health problems, including substance use disorders, non-suicidal self-injurious behaviors (NSSI) and suicidal behaviors (ideation, planning, attempts) have significantly increased in teens over the past two years as a result of COVID. Black youth and indigenous youth are particularly vulnerable to suicide and substance use disorders. For example, rates of suicidal behavioral and death by suicide among Black youth have risen at an alarming rate and faster than other; and suicide rates the highest among indigenous youth. iKinnect is an efficacious paired mobile app platform that supports parents (in delivering) and youth (in receiving) evidence-based techniques to reduce youth problem behaviors. This proposed fast-track seeks to adapt iKinnect to reduce substance use disorders while also preventing NSSI, suicidal behaviors (ideation, planning, attempts), and death by suicide among teens, including Black and indigenous youth.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Supplemental oxygen and mechanical ventilation used in premature infants causes lung vascular remodeling and pulmonary hypertension. Our proposed studies will elucidate the metabolic mechanisms underlying endothelial-mesenchymal transition during the development of pulmonary hypertension using lamb and mouse models of bronchopulmonary dysplasia. This research will have significant translational potential for the development of novel pharmacological approaches targeting fatty acid metabolism or endothelial-mesenchymal transition to prevent pulmonary hypertension in patients with bronchopulmonary dysplasia.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The proposed research will provide a foundation for understanding how cell fate decisions are controlled within an epithelial stem cell lineage. Epithelial stem cells are central to both normal homeostasis and the progression of diseases such as cancer, so understanding how they are regulated their native, in vivo contexts is important for the development of new diagnostics and therapeutics. The proposed project will also contribute to the NIH mission to foster fundamental creative discoveries by investigating new and poorly understood topics such as stem cell niche competition and the role of pH dynamics in cell fate decisions.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) bearing diffuse large B-cell lymphomas (DLBCL) are particularly aggressive in immunosuppressed individuals such as those with HIV – highlighting the importance of focusing on EBV- associated factors and pathways. In this application, a new collaboration enables the pursuit of a multi-pronged approach using novel proteolysis targeting chimeras to directly kill DLBCLs latently infected with EBV as well as indirectly kill DLBCL by forcing EBV into the lytic state allowing oncolysis, with the ultimate goal of improving outcomes for those with EBV+ DLBCL.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Overall - Project Narrative This project will use a learning healthcare system research framework to (1) develop and validate models for predicting Coordinated Specialty Care disengagement augmented by conversations with participants and clinicians to specify how this knowledge can be integrated with clinical practice and (2) develop and evaluate a centralized referral and intervention navigator service to support participants and families at high risk for disengagement. We will use robust participatory research methods to ensure the integration of CSC program staff, participants, and family members in the development of this service. Five research groups with histories of contributions to FEP/CSC research and clinical practice will collaborate to support these opportunities for in-depth study of disengagement risk and of strategies that can prevent it.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Clinical Practice Data Research Project - Project Narrative This project will use Connection Learning Healthcare System Core Assessment Battery data to develop and validate longitudinal models for predicting risk of Coordinated Specialty Care disengagement and to integrate stakeholder input on uses in clinical practice. We will develop several versions of a risk calculator predicting length of time in program, program completion, and disengagement and establish longitudinal validity over 2-3 years to compare different calculators’ predictive accuracy. We will leverage the Administrative Core’s community, provider, and lived experience integration strategies and components to develop implementation strategies for using risk information in practice.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Prospective Practice-Oriented Research Project - Project Narrative This project will develop a hub-based engagement navigator service for participants and families at high risk for disengagement. We will use robust Participatory Research methods to ensure integration of Coordinated Specialty Care (CSC) program staff, participants, and family members in developing all aspects of and materials for the service, conduct feasibility/acceptability testing in three CSC programs, and use this information to guide refinements. This will be followed by a mixed methods hub wide evaluation using a hybrid type I open cohort stepped wedge design to examine feasibility, acceptability, and effectiveness to improve disengagement outcomes and address target mechanisms.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Alzheimer's disease afflicts more than 6 million Americans, costs hundreds of billions of dollars a year, and is  the only major cause of death for which there is no treatment, and mutations in the SORL 1 gene, which codes  for a protein that helps to traffic other proteins to their correct destinations in brain cells, cause endosomal traffic  jams and are a significant factor in the development of both sporadic and familial Alzheimer's disease. This  project has an overall goal to develop the ability to predict which mutations in SORL 1 are pathogenic, and why,  and therefore which patients would benefit from treatments aimed at correcting the traffic jams. Specifically, the  project will contribute to this overall goal by relating pathogenic mutations to their effects on SORL 1 protein  structure, stability and biochemical functions.

IC_NAME: AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Health services researchers have only begun to adopt and apply modern data analytics, a subset of artificial intelligence. Data analytic tools may be particularly useful in understanding and addressing the health care inequities experienced by several AHRQ Priority Populations, especially women, racial and ethnic minorities, and persons in low-income, rural, and urban settings in the U.S. Deep South. The Annual Methods Symposium at the University of Alabama at Birmingham is uniquely positioned as a local, regional, and national outlet to disseminate knowledge of the health services research application of modern data analytic tools to a community of investigators who seek to improve care in the U.S. Deep South and beyond.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: OVERALL PROJECT NARRATIVE Bladder cancer is the second most common urologic malignancy; yet, remained a significantly underfunded and understudied cancer type. Major clinical gaps in early bladder lesions [defined as non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC)] include 1) lack of mechanistic insights defining NMIBC progression, and 2) lack of platform for risk stratifying NMIBC that recur but never progress, from those that progresses into MIBC and consequently demonstrate poor prognosis. The knowledge gained by our Center will inform future NIMBC management through 1) the development of novel urinary profiling strategies that could risk stratify aggressive NMIBC (Project 1-3); 2) the identification of targets for future precision intervention, either by enhancing/sustaining the tumor- restraining mechanisms (Project 1) and/or inhibiting the tumor-promoting mechanisms (Project 2).

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: In type 1 diabetes, the heart develops fibrosis and vascular damage that contribute to the heart’s eventual failure. Substance P, a molecule that activates the neurokinin-1 receptor, is reduced in diabetes, predisposing the heart to these adverse changes. The current proposal will explore interactions between substance P, the neurokinin 1 receptor, and adverse changes in the type 1 diabetic heart to assess the potential of activating the neurokinin 1 receptor as a therapy for adverse changes in the type 1 diabetic heart.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: Project Narrative Myoclonic Atonic Epilepsy is a severe neurological disorder that has been linked to loss of function mutations in the SLC6A1 gene. Reduced SLC6A1 expression and function leads to altered signals from inhibitory brain cells and results in developmental abnormalities and epilepsy, yet the role that SLC6A1 plays in the development of inhibitory brain cells and the resultant epilepsy remains unknown. We anticipate that these studies will contribute considerable knowledge to the epilepsy and neurodevelopmental fields, and lead to novel treatment strategies for individuals with severe childhood genetic epilepsies caused by mutations in SLC6A1 and related epilepsy genes.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE People with type 1 diabetes (T1D) have excessive risk for cardiovascular diseases (CVD) even with well-managed traditional cardio-metabolic risk factors. We propose to assess whether chronic autoimmunity could be contributing to the excessive mortality from CVD in T1D by using the blood vessels from the heart and lower limbs that are available from the CaRe-T1D and Medalist bio-repositories. The availability of these tissue libraries will allow in-depth analysis of cardiovascular tissues from T1D to be evaluated using cutting-edge tools such as single cell analysis, spatial transcriptomics, metabolomics and others in order to understand the potential and unusual causes of CVD in T1D due to the presence of autoimmunity.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: This Administrative Supplement to Promote Diversity in Health-Related Research will support the career development of Jose Mejia, a post-baccalaureate scholar who will receive a mentored research experience in preparation for applying for admission to nursing school. Under the guidance of Dr. Grant (PI for R01 DK134446: “Pragmatic Clinical Trial of Continuous Glucose Monitoring-based Interventions for Safe Insulin Prescribing in High-Risk Older Patients with Type 2 Diabetes, 02/01/2023 - 01/31/2028), Mr. Mejia will gain research experience by analyzing baseline data related to older Latino participants with type 2 diabetes eligible for the parent clinical trial (approximately 12% of expected participants, similar proportion to the source population in Northern California). The planned projects will supplement the parent R01 by allowing an increased emphasis on examining the similarities and unique differences in how older Latino patients with diabetes engage with the health care system and to current medication-related practices.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Relevance to Public Health This application is being submitted in response to the Notice of Special Interest (NOSI) identified as NOT-CA- 24-029, and relates to a funded parent award U01-CA254886 focused on genetic changes in solid tumors based on our novel ways for monitoring in live cell changes. Because changes in Tumor Suppressor levels is a well documented risk factor for many cancers, we focus here on their levels and mechanisms of changing them in relation to Chromosome loss – making use of our novel ChReporter methods that provide evidence of physically driven changes to chromosome number. We focus on epigenetic drugs emerging in the clinic and also take gene-specific CRISPR-activation & inhibition approaches to help clarify impacts of chromosome loss on expression levels of key Tumor Suppressors as well as Oncogenes. The work recruits into the NCI and its PSON anew collaboration and newInvestigator, Professor Karmella Haynes.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE (RELEVANCE)  This project will construct models of gene regulatory networks controlling early human development by taking an integrative approach involving perturbation of core regulatory network elements, quantitative genomic and proteomic measurements with high temporal and single-cell resolution, and systems level analyses. Knowledge gained from the study will provide a conceptual framework for dissecting gene regulatory networks during cell state transitions, and reveal general features of genomic variants that contribute to cellular and organismal phenotypes.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ARTHRITIS AND MUSCULOSKELETAL AND SKIN DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Advancements in the treatment and functional restoration of composite bone-muscle traumas are hindered by a lack of available therapies that can repair both of these tissues together. In the parent grant, we proposed to engineer regenerative materials that work in concert with the body’s healing programs and physical rehabilitation to restore the structure-function relationship within and between damaged muscle and bone. The goals of this Research Supplement to Promote Diversity in Health-Related Research are to: 1) to train a highly innovative biomedical engineering graduate student to integrate concepts in biomechanics with regenerative rehabilitation models in musculoskeletal research; 2) determine the impact of load-bearing exercise on muscle/bone regeneration after traumatic injury; 3) evaluate the contribution of exercise intervention timing and intensity on the systemic inflammatory response and functional limb recovery.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: RELEVANCE (See instructions): We are examining the role of the myosin molecular motor during aging of healthy and diseased muscles and are attempting to ameliorate muscle degeneration. To this end, we are 1) modeling aging human skeletal muscle by studying myosin with modifications found in human biopsies from aged individuals, 2) over- or under-expressing proteins that are dysregulated in two myosin-based progressive diseases of skeletal muscle and 3) studying mutant cardiac myosins that cause age-related dilated cardiomyopathy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The opioid crisis has inflicted a tremendous socioeconomic burden and resulted in the countless loss of lives. In order to further initiatives geared towards resolving the opioid crisis with novel treatments, basic neurophysiological mechanisms that underlie pathological opioid behaviors need to be elucidated. The goal of this proposal is use combinatorial genetic, photometric, electrophysiological, and machine-learning based behavioral analysis to decode the behavioral and neural correlates of the heterogeneous mesolimbic dopamine system that regulate morphine response and associative learning in non-dependent and morphine-dependent mice.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
ORG_NAME: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI
PHR: Project Narrative GUARDD-US: People with African ancestry (AAs) have the highest rates of uncontrolled high blood pressure, chronic kidney disease and kidney failure, due in part to APOL1 genetic variants nearly exclusively found in AAs that increase risk of kidney failure up to 10-fold. We will test AA adults with high blood pressure for APOL1 and return the results to patients and their clinicians, to see if early knowledge of high genetic risk improves blood pressure, provider and patient behaviors and is cost effective. ADOPT PGx: Certain genetic variations have been shown to cause poor, intermediate or ultra-rapid of commonly prescribed opioid and SSRI medications, thus genotype guided prescribing like that proposed in this study has the potential to greatly improve treatment and quality of life for patients with pain and depression.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Despite the effectiveness of CAR T therapy for patients with refractory B cell malignancies, approximately 50% of patients relapse within one year of treatment. A common cause of relapse is the emergence of CAR-resistant leukemias. Our proposal develops two key models for studying mechanisms of relapse following cellular therapy for leukemia and identifies avenues for improving durability of remission.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Natural vocal communication relies on the perception and production of signals influenced by internal states and environmental conditions. The proposed project aims to unify our neurobiological understanding of context-dependent auditory perception and vocal production in songbirds by integrating both behaviors into a common analytical framework. This proposal outlines a novel approach to understanding how networks of neurons can affect different behavioral goals, offering insight into how neural population dynamics shape complex, flexible behaviors through conserved mechanisms.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Despite the critical influence of both aging and the immune system on carcinogenesis there is little understanding of the interplay between aging and anti-cancer immune responses. IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Program Director/Principal Investigator (Last, First, Middle): Bekker, Linda-Gail The University of Cape Town Clinical Trials Unit (UCTCTU) based at the Desmond Tutu HIV Centre, University of Cape Town has four unique, expert and integrated clinical research sites which are ready and willing to contribute to the research priorities of the 4 NIH funded clinical trial Networks namely the ACTG, IMPAACT, HPTN and HVTN. Collaboratively this clinical trials consortium will utilise the experience and expertise of the core and it’s sites to efficiently and effectively promote the research and development of new innovations in treatment, prevention and management of HIV, tuberculosis and related conditions.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: Project Narrative Emerging data from our parent grant support the novel concept that age-related detrimental changes in the dermal compartment drive skin cancer initiation. The aged dermis drives cancer initiation, in part, by influencing the functions of skin immune cells. This supplemental proposal seeks to use the most advanced high-definition spatial gene expression tools to extend the findings of the parent grant by examining the interactions of immune cells with the aged dermis during cancer initiation.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative The MetNet Center for Systems-level Study of Metastasis will elucidate how dynamic interactions between neuronal cells, localized lymphatics, metabolites and cancer cells collectively contribute to the emergence of metastatic disease—thereby identifying critical genes as therapeutic targets for its eradication.
